intro: Glossorhyncha monticuprina, commonly known as the mountain mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Appalachian Mountains. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant features delicate, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Glossorhyncha monticuprina is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
